summary: The Arctic Refuge Protection Act aims to repeal the oil and gas program established by Public Law 115-97 (the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act) within the Arctic National Wildlife Refuge. It seeks to designate approximately 1,559,538 acres of the refuge's coastal plain in Alaska as wilderness, integrating it into the National Wilderness Preservation System. The bill's stated objectives include preserving the area's natural ecosystems and ensuring its protection for future generations.
